description:
Samoa declared that fishing boats will be denied entry effective 18 April with exemption for deep sea fishing vessels permitted for offloading, refueling and supplies up to 26 April 2020. On May 1 Fishing boats have updated guidelines for docking in Samoa including: fishing boats approved for offloading, refueling and the restock of necessary supplies only; (a) a maximum of 2 boats may dock in a day; and
(b) medical and quarantine requirements are to be complied with;
(c) no crew member is to leave the boat;
(d) boat schedules must be submitted to the Samoa Ports Authority (SPA); Ministry of Agriculture and Fisheries (MAF); Ministry of Police and Prisons Services (MOPPS) and the Ministry of Health (MOH); and
(e) the date of departure from the last port, or the exchange of any crew members whilst at sea, must not be less than 28 days, before arrival at Apia wharf; and
(f) notification of arrival date must be received by the relevant authorities (MAF and SPA) 5 days prior; and
(g) there shall be no exchange of crew members whilst as sea.
target_geog_level: All countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description:
On June 22 Samoa released travel guidelines for passengers entering form New Zealand. 
Travelers from New Zealand
All are required to complete the Health Declaration Card in flight.
All are required to have a COVID-19 test done within three days before arrival
All are required to undergo medical examination by a Registered Medical Practitioner within (3) days before ARRIVAL.
All are required to present a hard copy of COVID19 test and medical report on arrival to health officers
quarantined for 14 days upon arrival into Samoa at a designated location.
required to wear a face mask at all times and advised to maintain social distancing in flight.
All TRAVELLERS OUTSIDE OF NEW ZEALAND MUST SPEND 28 DAYS OR MORE IN NEW ZEALAND BEFORE ONWARD TRAVEL TO SAMOA AND MUST COMPLY WITH ALL REQUIREMENTS.
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description:
On June 24 Samoa updated its fishing boats policy to include: (a) may dock at Matautu Wharf for not more than 48 hours for the offloading of fish and restocking of the supplies before leaving Samoa; and
(b) medical and quarantine requirements are to be complied with; and
(c) no crew member is to leave the boat; and
(d) boat schedules must be submitted to the Samoa Ports Authority (SPA); Ministry of Agriculture and Fisheries (MAF); Ministry of Police and Prisons Services (MOPPS) and the Ministry of Health (MOH); and
(e) the date of departure from the last port, or the exchange of any crew members whilst at sea, must not be less than 28 days, before arrival at Apia wharf; and
(f) notification of arrival date must be received by the relevant authorities (MAF and SPA) 5 days prior; and
(g) there shall be no exchange of crew members whilst as sea.
(5) For trade boats, a maximum of 2 trade boats are permitted to be docked at Matautu Wharf at one time and must meet safety requirements set by Samoa Ports Authority and other relevant Government entities.
(6) The Ministry of Health is to continue with the approved medical clearance of all involved.
(7) Travelling conditions permitted under subclause (2)(c) cease once American Samoa opens its borders for travel to and from Hawaii.
type_sub_cat: Travel History Form (e.g. documents where traveler has recently been)
target_geog_level: All countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

(1) There shall be no selling of any goods beside roads, street, culverts or footpaths.

On May 8 Samoa updated the ban on street vendors to list specific areas where they are banned: There shall be no selling of any goods beside roads, street, culverts, street islands or footpaths in the town areas of Apia, beginning from Mulinuu to Fugalei, Taufusi, Motootua, Matautu Tai and Savalalo.
type_text: Samoa banned street vendors and children selling on the street.
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied)

type_text: This policy bans the presence of street vendors, they are neither strictly a business nor a policy for social distancing
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

(1) There shall be no selling of any goods beside roads, street, culverts or footpaths.
(2) Children selling goods in public is strictly prohibited.

Samoa originally banned all street vendors on March 21. On June 10 vendors are allowed in some areas with restrictions. UPDATE: Samoa originally banned all street vendors on March 21. On June 10 vendors are allowed in some areas with restrictions.

description:
On June 26 in Samoa, the general public is hereby advised that access to the following sites are restricted :
• International Port – Faleolo International Airport (Saturday 27 June 2020; 12am-11.59pm)
• All Quarantine Sites (27 June – 11 July 2020 at all times)
Only authorized personnel pre-approved by the Ministry of Health (MOH) and the National Emergency Operation Centre (NEOC) are permitted to enter the above sites to conduct required services.
type_text: The government is restricting access to the airport and quarantine sites to official personnel only.
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: Samoan government publicly addresses a false social media statement claiming there was a positive Coronavirus in Samoa. The government restates that there are currently no confirmed cases of Coronavirus in Samoa as of March 14. The government recommends basic precautions for citizens, avoiding online gossip, and using official channels for information.

description:
Samoa is allowing church services to be held with the following restrictions: 
(a) there shall be one church service on Sabbath day (e.g. on Sunday for EFKS, on Saturday for SDA); and
(b) social distancing of 2 meters is to be observed; and
(c) there shall be no crowds around church buildings before and after the church service, or for any other after church activities; and
(d) the church Minister (faifeau) is to ensure the 2 meter social distancing in the church is adhered to.

description: The restrictions on private events including funerals, traditional title bestowals, birthdays, weddings; reunions; and opening ceremonies for buildings (umusaga) were restricted to 5 people on May 1. On June 17 these gatherings are now allowed to have up to 100 people. UPDATE: The restrictions on private events including funerals, traditional title bestowals, birthdays, weddings; reunions; and opening ceremonies for buildings (umusaga) were restricted to 5 people on May 1. On June 17 these gatherings are now allowed to have up to 100 people.

description:
On June3, Samoa is now exempting weddings from the 5 person gathering restriction on May 20. Weddings may only be permitted to take place in Hotels but are restricted to 50 couples and must finish at 10pm.
As of June 17, wedding are now allowed to take place in wedding venues ending the mandate on June 3 that they only take place in hotels. UPDATE: As of June 17, wedding are now allowed to take place in wedding venues ending the mandate on June 3 that they only take place in hotels.

Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description:
On July 3 in Samoa restrictions regarding church services were updated: (a) combined church services (tapuaiga tuufaatasi), meetings and Tofiga a Ekalesia are permitted but attendance is restricted to 50 couples;
(b) social distancing of 2 meters is to be observed; and
(c) the church Minister (faifeau) is to ensure the 2 meter social distancing in the church is adhered to.
Church and Congregations only can have luncheons (to’onai) on Sunday.
type_sub_cat: Attendance at religious services restricted (e.g. mosque/church closings)
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines
